description.zh-cn: 原名熊耀华，著名武侠小说家。籍贯江西省南昌市，出生于香港，后定居台湾。其作品风格独特，开创了武侠小说的新时代，代表作有《楚留香传奇》、《绝代双骄》、《多情剑客无情剑》等。
description.en: Real name Xiong Yaohua, a renowned wuxia novelist. His ancestral home was Nanchang, Jiangxi, he was born in Hong Kong, and later settled in Taiwan. His unique style pioneered a new era for wuxia novels, with representative works including 'The Legend of Chu Liuxiang', 'Juedai Shuangjiao', and 'Sentimental Swordsman, Ruthless Sword'.

description.zh-cn: 古龙之父，曾以“东方客”为笔名发表武侠小说。
description.en: Gu Long's father, who published wuxia novels under the pen name 'Dongfang Ke'.

description.zh-cn: 古龙的第一任妻子，与其同居并育有长子郑小龙。
description.en: Gu Long's first wife, with whom he cohabited and had his eldest son, Zheng Xiaolong.

description.zh-cn: 古龙与郑月霞之子，古龙的长子。
description.en: The son of Gu Long and Zheng Yuexia, Gu Long's eldest son.

description.zh-cn: 古龙正式登记结婚的妻子，两人育有一子熊正达。
description.en: Gu Long's officially registered wife, with whom he had a son, Xiong Zhengda.

description.zh-cn: 古龙在台北北投吟松阁与友人饮酒时，因不愿向演员柯俊雄敬酒，遭其友人刺伤。古龙因此次受伤输血而染上肝炎，健康状况急剧恶化。
description.en: While drinking with friends at the Yinsong Pavilion in Beitou, Taipei, Gu Long was stabbed by associates of actor Ko Chun-hsiung after refusing to toast him. Due to a blood transfusion received for his injuries, Gu Long contracted hepatitis, which led to a sharp decline in his health.

description.zh-cn: 台湾演员，因敬酒纠纷引发了吟松阁事件。
description.en: A Taiwanese actor whose dispute over a toast led to the Yinsong Pavilion Incident.

description.zh-cn: 香港作家，古龙的莫逆之交。
description.en: A Hong Kong writer and a very close friend of Gu Long.

description.zh-cn: 著名武侠小说家，对古龙评价甚高，并称其为相当熟的朋友。
description.en: A famous wuxia novelist who held Gu Long in high regard and referred to him as a good friend.

description.zh-cn: 古龙创作的长篇武侠喜剧，是其创作茁壮阶段的重要作品。
description.en: A long-form wuxia comedy written by Gu Long, a major work from his formative period.

description.zh-cn: 古龙创作的武侠小说，开启了其创作的成熟阶段。
description.en: A wuxia novel by Gu Long that marked the beginning of his mature creative phase.

description.zh-cn: 古龙创作的系列武侠小说。
description.en: A series of wuxia novels written by Gu Long.

description.zh-cn: 由古龙于1980年创办的电影公司，名称取自其与妻子梅宝珠的名字。
description.en: A film company founded by Gu Long in 1980, named after himself and his wife, Mei Baozhu.

nodes.id: 台北市立成功高级中学

zh-cn: 台北市立成功高级中学

description.zh-cn: 位于台湾台北市的男子高级中学。
description.en: A boys' senior high school located in Taipei, Taiwan.

description.zh-cn: 位于台湾新北市的私立综合大学。
description.en: A private comprehensive university located in New Taipei City, Taiwan.

description.zh-cn: 香港的电影制作公司，曾将多部古龙小说改编为电影。
description.en: A film production company in Hong Kong that adapted many of Gu Long's novels into movies.

description.zh-cn: 香港导演，曾与古龙、倪匡经常合作，拍摄了多部古龙小说改编的电影，开创了古龙电影的辉煌时代。
description.en: A Hong Kong director who frequently collaborated with Gu Long and Ni Kuang, directing numerous film adaptations of Gu Long's novels and ushering in a golden era for Gu Long's movies.

description.zh-cn: 熊鹏声因婚外情抛弃妻儿，导致古龙愤而离家出走，中断了在成功高中的学业。
description.en: Xiong Pengsheng's extramarital affair and abandonment of his family caused Gu Long to angrily leave home, interrupting his studies at Chenggong High School.

description.zh-cn: 古龙于1963年起与第一任妻子郑月霞同居。
description.en: Starting in 1963, Gu Long cohabited with his first wife, Zheng Yuexia.

description.zh-cn: 古龙于1976年与梅宝珠正式登记结婚，但婚姻几年后以离婚告终。
description.en: Gu Long officially registered his marriage with Mei Baozhu in 1976, but the marriage ended in divorce a few years later.

description.zh-cn: 演员柯俊雄因古龙不愿向其敬酒而引发争执，导致其友人刺伤古龙。
description.en: Actor Ko Chun-hsiung's dispute with Gu Long over a toast led to his associates stabbing Gu Long.

description.zh-cn: 古龙在吟松阁事件中被刺伤，后因输血感染肝炎，健康状况急剧恶化，影响了后期的写作能力。
description.en: Gu Long was stabbed in the Yinsong Pavilion Incident and subsequently contracted hepatitis from a blood transfusion, causing a sharp decline in his health and affecting his later writing abilities.

description.zh-cn: 古龙与倪匡是莫逆之交，两人在影剧事业上亦有合作。
description.en: Gu Long and Ni Kuang were very close friends and also collaborated in the film and television industry.

description.zh-cn: 倪匡为香港《明报》向古龙邀稿，促成了《绝代双骄》的诞生。
description.en: Ni Kuang invited Gu Long to write for Hong Kong's Ming Pao, which led to the creation of 'Juedai Shuangjiao'.

description.zh-cn: 金庸称古龙为“相当熟的朋友”，并在自己封笔后亲自为旗下《明报》向古龙邀稿。
description.en: Jin Yong referred to Gu Long as a 'very good friend' and personally invited him to write for his newspaper, Ming Pao, after he had stopped writing.

description.zh-cn: 金庸封笔后亲自为旗下的《明报》向古龙邀稿，促成了《陆小凤》系列的发表。
description.en: After retiring from writing, Jin Yong personally invited Gu Long to contribute to his newspaper, Ming Pao, which led to the publication of 'The Legend of Lu Xiaofeng' series.

description.zh-cn: 古龙创作了武侠小说《多情剑客无情剑》。
description.en: Gu Long authored the wuxia novel 'Sentimental Swordsman, Ruthless Sword'.

description.zh-cn: 古龙创作了武侠小说《绝代双骄》。
description.en: Gu Long authored the wuxia novel 'Juedai Shuangjiao'.

relationships.target: 台北市立成功高级中学

description.zh-cn: 1954年秋考入成功中学，高二时因家庭变故弃学离家。
description.en: Enrolled in Chenggong High School in the autumn of 1954, but dropped out and left home during his second year due to family issues.

description.zh-cn: 1957年秋考入淡江英专夜间部英语科，大二时为谋生而辍学。
description.en: Enrolled in the English Department of the evening division at Tamkang Junior College of English in the autumn of 1957, but dropped out during his sophomore year to make a living.

description.zh-cn: 古龙于1980年创办了宝龙电影公司，投身影剧事业。
description.en: Gu Long founded the Baolong Film Company in 1980, dedicating himself to the film and television industry.

description.zh-cn: 邵氏兄弟于1976年将古龙小说《流星·蝴蝶·剑》及《天涯‧明月‧刀》改编成电影并大获成功，缔造了古龙的电影时代。
description.en: In 1976, Shaw Brothers Studio successfully adapted Gu Long's novels 'Meteor, Butterfly, Sword' and 'The Magic Blade' into films, creating a golden era for Gu Long's movies.

description.zh-cn: 导演楚原拍摄了多部古龙小说改编的电影，对古龙作品的影视化推广起到了关键作用。
description.en: Director Chor Yuen directed many film adaptations of Gu Long's novels, playing a key role in promoting his works in film and television.
